robot_stepper_client.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """
4 CLIENT OF THE SERVICE :
5 Service emulates the robot IE: Given a state and an action, picks a random valid next state
6 and returns corresponding (state_next, reward, done, info) tuple.
7 
8 This is intended to be included in other scripts where the .step() function performs a service call
9 Terminal execution performs a test call based on runtime arguments
10 
11 @params of service
12 Request
13 int64 state - Current state
14 int64 action - Selected action
15 string terminating - True if using terminating model, else False
16 Response
17 int64 state_next - Randomly chosen valid next state
18 int64 reward - Immedeate reward
19 bool terminal - Is done?
20 string info - Additional info
21 
22 """
23 
24 import sys
25 import rospy
26 from tejas.srv import EnvStep
27 
28 
29 
30 def step(state, action, terminating="False"):
31  """
32  @params
33  state - input state
34  action - input action
35  terminating - use terminating model if true, else use non terminating model
36  s_ - next state
37  r - reward
38  t - if terminal
39  i - info
40 
41  @description
42  Steps the robot from given state with given action and returns the result
43  Invokes a service to acquire the results
44  """
45  rospy.wait_for_service("robot_emulator_service")
46  try:
47  emulator_service_client = rospy.ServiceProxy("robot_emulator_service", EnvStep)
48  response = emulator_service_client(state, action, terminating)
49  return response.state_next, response.reward, response.terminal, response.info
50  except rospy.ServiceException as error:
51  print("Service call failed :", error)
52 
53 
54 def usage():
55  """
56  Defines the usage when called directly
57  """
58  return "{} [state action terminating]".format(sys.argv[0])
59 
60 
61 if __name__ == "__main__":
62  if len(sys.argv) == 4:
63  STATE = int(sys.argv[1])
64  ACTION = int(sys.argv[2])
65  TERM = sys.argv[3]
66  else:
67  print(usage())
68  sys.exit(1)
69  string = TERM
70  print("Requesting {} {} {}".format(STATE, ACTION, string))
71  s_, r, t, i = step(STATE, ACTION, string)
72  print("S_={} R={} T={} I={} ".format(s_, r, t, i))
